snippet: At the University of Washington, 18 percent of the freshmen are foreigners, and each pays about three times as much as students from Washington State.
abstract: University of Washington has rankled some local politicians and parents with their decision to pull back on admissions offers to Washington residents and increase them to students overseas after state financing is slashed by more than half; international students' higher tuition costs are used to subsidize the costs of tuition for other students, and there is a widespread belief at the university that internationalization is the key to the future; many public universities nationwide are beginning to make similar changes.
lead_paragraph: At the University of Washington, 18 percent of the freshmen are foreigners, and each pays about three times as much as students from Washington State.

headline.seo: International Students Pay Top Dollar at U.S. Colleges
headline.main: Taking More Seats on Campus, Foreigners Also Pay the Freight
headline.print_headline: Taking More Seats on Campus, Foreigners Also Pay the Freight
